https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/73387/ : SUCCESS
Overall I'm finding this difficult to process. Maybe a little more background on what error types are and how they're used?
I added what is error type and why it should be considered as dump type too
nit: define functions in cpp file in same order they are in hpp
I'm a bit confused on why we need this new check. There are situations where values in the DUMP_TYPE_TABLE can overlap with values in the ERROR_TYPE_DICT? Why is that?
Yes the each error type is considered as a dump type for eacmple elog error type is given as elog dump type and checkstop error type is checkstop dump type too. Updated commit message also

At a high level does this make sense to you? A checkstop dump to me is a dump that collects host/bios related data. Maybe the BMC also logs an error to indicate it has detected a checkstop and that generates a BMC dump. But those are 2 different dumps. Why not a checkstop and checkstop_bmc so we don't have this weird overlap issue?

Checkstop dump not making a clash, the elog is the problem, elog is used as an error log dump and for InternalFailure too, maybe I should change the type for InternalFailure from 'elog' to 'internalfailure' but that change is only in the yaml.

Yeah I'm just not getting it here. In my mind, either all BMC dumps generated by error logs are a single type of BMC dump, or all BMC dumps generated by error logs are separate BMC dump types. Either way, there shouldn't be any duplication to worry about.

checkstop type are consumed by openpower boxes. Refer 
https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-openpower/recipes-phosphor/dump/phosphor-debug-errors-native/errors_watch.yaml.
For IBM specific boxes , checkstop type dump is also using error log type dump infrastructure to watch the error logs. 
At a high level elog type is used to capture general error log type dump data , which includes journal( limited) and addition base dump info.
Checkstop captures cutsom information like host specific info and elog type.
The design direction we followed  is close to your statement  "all BMC dumps generated by error logs are separate BMC dump types.". Like errors which doesn't need custom data use  elog type or use custom type for any custom data collection case.

"Like errors which doesn't need custom data use elog type or use custom type for any custom data collection case."
That was the original change, if type elog is mentioned and no subtype is mentioned collect the default elog dump or the specific elog type. 
Based on the review comment I changed that.

so we can do either of these
- In the bus call dump type as elog and if there is no additional type, collect default dump, or if something is specified collect the particular dump

- keep the current behavior, elog for InternalFailure, and for other error logs need to specify the type. Current behavior means whatever is merged and in this review 

is this documented anywhere?
"Like errors which doesn't need custom data use elog type or use custom type for any custom data collection case."

>In the bus call dump type as elog and if there is no additional type, collect default dump, or if something is specified collect the particular dump

Are you referring the the latest dump d-bus definition , Additional types  name: "DumpType" and  name: "ErrorType" here right.  we can use these additional parameters for supporting "ErrorLog" type sub type dumps. Existing dreport plugin installation script is based on dump type.  Considering the existing  code support seeing some disconnect between  checkstop type dump and d-bus definition. How you are planing to make the d-bus type and dreport configuration files definition common with this approach?

>"Like errors which doesn't need custom data use elog type or use custom type for any custom data collection case."
this is the design assumption we followed during initial design time. No documentation update related to this. Let me know you want to update the proposed one the existing dump manager documentation, https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/designs/dump-manager.md.

" Existing dreport plugin installation script is based on dump type. Considering the existing code support seeing some disconnect between the checkstop type dump and the d-bus definition"

There is no disconnect, we don't need to define the same parameter in yaml and dbus, the only condition is additional parameters is, it should not be a free-form text, since the validation is done based on the yaml, I don't think that is an issue.

https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/designs/dump-manager.md.

This is not a document created specifically to BMC dump but when adding other types of dumps over BMC dumps, means the functionality or assumption was existed before creating this document.

"How you are planing to make the d-bus type and dreport configuration files definition common with this approach?"

Now there is one yaml parser which takes both input yamls and create appropriate maps and enum

Both dreport and plugin infrastructure is heavily depend on the dump type. Need to look the impact on the new d-bus based dump types. 
dreport plugin infrastructure uses https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/blob/master/tools/dreport.d/sample.conf file to install plugin based on the dump type specific path. And this doesn’t support type-subtype based dump type numbering now. Since you’re trying to remove internal create interface definition, looking your plan to support the existing dump types with this approach. This is the disconnect am referring here.

See the dump types are defined in the DBus and one among the dump type is error log dump, 
since custom data can be collected based on the error type, which is also a dump type for the dreport
All these are defined in the yaml which corresponds to the implementation
in the dreport. 

One problem I see here is regarding checkstop, which is defined in meta-openpower and is implemented for all kinds of systems in the dreport. The removal of checkstop from the dreport should be a separate refactoring activity and that is not the scope of this commit

Andrew brought up this question to get more clarity on your refactoring work. Not specific to this commit.
Added data to help your refactoring work. like refactoring should  consider all existing use case including the dreport plugin infrastructure.

This is basically covering all these existing scenraios, and without disrupting dreport

Dump Types
   User, core, ramoops, elog
   
and if dump type is elog, the dump type can be
   elog - right now only InternalFailure
   checkstop - for checkstop and watchdog on openpower systems
   
and to dreport the input goes as -t <user/core/ramoops/elog/checkstop>

And addditionaly in future for an error log, complete user dump needs to be collected, that can be mentioned in the yaml like this

user:
  - xyz.openbmc_project.Common.Error.<some_failure>
  
without adding the unique check that wont be possible

Ahh, so the example above helps. I think the confusing part is that we have a "elog" dump type, it can then be a elog dump type or a checkstop dump type. How does that make any sense? It should just be a "elog" dump type and we collect a generic set of data for all elog dumps. Or to be honest, we could look into just getting rid of elog dump types. We've moved past the InternalFailure issues for the most part and most people just manually call PDC to create a BMC dump when they need it for their errors.

I think reverse, but a point to discuss
There is a requirement to enbedd the PEL ID of the PEL responsible for creating the error, with a new commit we can get the PEL ID into the BMC dump, in that case, we can add like this to the error watch yaml to create error

user:
  - xyz.openbmc_project.Common.Error.<failure_to_create_error>

Andrew, elog type dump is introduced to capture additional data specific to SEL , due to the size limitation data capture of SEL. Currently in upstream code IBM meta layer extend this usage to open power specific data collection for Power9 version processor to capture Host failure . In the Power 10 version uses SystemDump type , which helps capture all data required to debug Host failure. We should Keep elog type Dump and enhance the infrastructure to align with new d-bus create interface  "DumpType" and "ErrorType". Also the dreport conf file dump type definition should align with this also.    Currently dreport plugin uses  below format , which is good to support dump type. we may need to enhance this format to support subtype like, will solve this issue. Like dump type is elog , read additional type , if it is present as 3rd parameter. 
 config A B
    'A' is a sequence of the dump types from the mapping defined in sample.conf.
    'B' is a priority determines the order the plugins run in.
    
   This approach will help to contain subtype info inside PDC , some thing similar we did for internal dbus interface.

The external dbus is already accepting error type as a separate parameter and we may need to add more error types or PEL types to capture dump as we need a mapping between events and dump. 

I didnt really get the last part of it, are you saying changes needed in dreport?

I think we should have a single dumpType for error logs and just pass a parameter with the SEL/SRC associated with it. Then everyone can move from calling the generic "user dump" to this new one. And then we only have one error log dump type.

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Dump/Create.interface.yaml

We already have that interface, but not yet implemented, planning to have that in future, an option to pass EID to the dump

          - name: "EventId"
            description: >
                The identifier for an event that triggers the BMC dump. When a
                BMC dump is initiated as a response to a specific system event,
                this parameter can be supplied with the unique ID associated
                with that event. By linking the dump to an event ID, the system
                can collate additional, relevant diagnostic data or add this
                into the dump to aid in providing a clearer context.
                
                
But we still need to support this automatic dump capture for some of the errors right?

I feel like mixing this auto-capture on certain errors has really confused the code. I say lets drop it (and tell people to use the interface that you'll implement if they want a dump for an error log) or treat that whole function as a completely separate application that monitors for errors and calls the dump interface like everyone else will.

So 
Option no1: Drop the elog dump and any application trying to create a dump can pass a EID

2: Create a elog monitor, which monitors for error logs and call the phosphor-dump-manager with a dump type and eid to create dump

right?
This commit is not changing the functionality, shall we have a separate commit later to do the modifications on the elog behavior?

Can we just leave whatever we have as-is for now and add this commit to that TODO story?

In the end, I just think we've found something that is pretty confusing with our implementation in this repo. We've mixed having this code auto detect errors and create dumps and providing a mechanism for other applications to call this code and create dumps for error logs. The mako file change in this commit highlighted this.

But now that I understand it a bit better, I'm ok if the maintainers wants to just merge this for now with the understanding that it's not adding anything new (but I don't plan on giving a +1 myself).

But we can do either of these
1- Drop elog type of dump, and implement the passing of eid as a parameter
or
2- All applications stop calling the user-initiated dumps and add corresponding errors to the watch list
to be consistent?

> All applications stop calling the user-initiated dumps and add corresponding errors to the watch list : 
As i mentioned earlier elog type is designed to support additional user data specific to the failure , I am not a big fan of collecting user initiated dump for application specific failure unless there is strong reason for collecting system snapshot. 
I am ok to keep existing behavior and get this commit in. Please address/respond other open comments.
Should have doxygen for new functions
This feels a bit awkward. Either define specific names for yaml1 and yaml2 or just support multiple -i inputs for multiple yaml files.
changed but means an empty optional
need to run clang on this
is this statment valid, from the code it does not look like that
this is no more valid, will remove
suggest to rename it to "example_errors_watch.yaml" as this is the existing file, even though file name comes from meson_options.txt. For clarity as I was trying to look where is this yaml file.
Change to ErrorType , just to align the naming convention used in line 27 and 28.
